subject: Technology
title: Infinite Scroll: Designed to Never End
description: Learn Infinite Scroll: Designed to Never End in one minute.

hook.text: Infinite scroll was invented by one developer. He now says it's one of his biggest regrets.

buildup.text: Before infinite scroll, pages ended. You had to click 'next page' to see more. That pause was a natural stopping point.

discovery.text: Aza Raskin created infinite scroll in 2006. It eliminated friction and kept users engaged seamlessly.

twist.text: Raskin estimates his invention wastes 200,000 human lifetimes per day. People scroll for hours without ever choosing to continue.

climax.text: Infinite scroll is now in every major app. Removing friction removed our ability to naturally stop.

punchline.text: The scroll never ends because stopping you was never the goal.

quiz.question: Why does Aza Raskin regret inventing infinite scroll?
options: It removed natural stopping points and wastes vast amounts of human time
It caused technical problems for developers
